metadata.description: Most essential Spanish verbs - fundamental for basic communication

present.english: I speak Spanish with my friends.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Hablas muy bien inglés para ser estudiante.
present.english: You (informal) speak English very well for a student.
present.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Hablé con el director sobre mi proyecto.
preterite.english: I spoke with the director about my project.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Hablaste con mucha pasión sobre el tema.
preterite.english: You spoke with great passion about the topic.
preterite.subject: vos

future.spanish: Hablaré en la conferencia internacional mañana.
future.english: I will speak at the international conference tomorrow.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Hablarás muy bien después de estudiar más.
future.english: You (informal) will speak very well after studying more.
future.subject: tú

present-progressive.spanish: Estás hablando muy rápido, no te entiendo.
present-progressive.english: You (informal) are speaking very fast; I don't understand you (informal).
present-progressive.subject: tú

present-progressive.spanish: Estás hablando como un verdadero argentino.
present-progressive.english: You are speaking like a true Argentine.
present-progressive.subject: vos

going-to.spanish: Voy a hablar con el director mañana.
going-to.english: I'm going to talk with the director tomorrow.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Vas a hablar en la conferencia la próxima semana.
going-to.english: You (informal)'re going to speak at the conference next week.
going-to.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: Has hablado con tu familia sobre el trabajo.
present-perfect.english: You have talked with your family about work.
present-perfect.subject: vos

present-perfect.spanish: Ha hablado con el médico sobre los síntomas.
present-perfect.english: He has talked with the doctor about the symptoms.
present-perfect.subject: él

present.spanish: Comemos juntos en familia los domingos.
present.english: We eat together as a family on Sundays.
present.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Comí paella por primera vez en Valencia.
preterite.english: I ate paella for the first time in Valencia.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Comiste un asado muy bueno en casa de tu tío.
preterite.english: You ate a very good barbecue at your uncle's place.
preterite.subject: vos

quality.fix_issue: Argentina phrase → use 'casa de tu tío' for MX

future.spanish: Comerás empanadas caseras en casa de la abuela.
future.english: You will eat homemade empanadas at grandma's house.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Comerán comida orgánica en el nuevo restaurante.
future.english: They will eat organic food at the new restaurant.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present-progressive.spanish: Estamos comiendo juntos en familia el domingo próximo.
present-progressive.english: We are eating together as a family this coming Sunday.
present-progressive.subject: nosotros

quality.fix_issue: Improved idiomaticity: habitual 'los domingos' → specific 'el domingo próximo'
quality.improvement_reason: Progressive tense more natural for planned future events

present-progressive.spanish: Estás comiendo muy saludable esta semana.
present-progressive.english: You (informal) are eating very healthy this week.
present-progressive.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Vamos a comer juntos en familia los domingos.
going-to.english: We're going to eat together as a family on Sundays.
going-to.subject: nosotros

going-to.spanish: ¿Vas a comer ahora?
going-to.english: Are you going to eat now?
going-to.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: Hemos comido juntos en familia los domingos.
present-perfect.english: We have eaten together as a family on Sundays.
present-perfect.subject: nosotros

present-perfect.spanish: He comido frutas y verduras todos los días.
present-perfect.english: I have eaten fruits and vegetables every day.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present.spanish: Vivimos en una casa grande con jardín.
present.english: We live in a big house with a garden.
present.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Viviste un tiempo muy bueno en Japón.
preterite.english: You had a very good time in Japan.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Viví en París durante mis estudios universitarios.
preterite.english: I lived in Paris during my university studies.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Vivirás experiencias únicas en tu nuevo trabajo.
future.english: You will have unique experiences in your new job.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Vivirá en una casa frente al mar.
future.english: He will live in a house facing the sea.
future.subject: él

present-progressive.spanish: Estamos viviendo en una casa grande con jardín.
present-progressive.english: We are living in a big house with a garden.
present-progressive.subject: nosotros

present-progressive.spanish: Estamos viviendo en el centro de la ciudad ahora.
present-progressive.english: We are living in the city center now.
present-progressive.subject: nosotros

quality.fix_issue: Replaced present-perfect meaning with proper present-progressive
quality.replacement_reason: Original was present-perfect continuous, not simple progressive

present-progressive.spanish: Estoy viviendo en la Avenida Central estos días.
present-progressive.english: I am living on Central Avenue these days.
present-progressive.subject: yo

quality.fix_issue: Added proper present-progressive sentence for subject variety
quality.addition_reason: Provides yo subject for VIVIR present-progressive

going-to.spanish: Vamos a vivir en una casa grande con jardín.
going-to.english: We're going to live in a big house with a garden.
going-to.subject: nosotros

going-to.spanish: Voy a vivir en el centro de la ciudad.
going-to.english: I'm going to live in the city center.
going-to.subject: yo

quality.fix_issue: Spanish construction impossible ('desde hace años' + future)

present-perfect.spanish: Hemos vivido en una casa grande con jardín.
present-perfect.english: We have lived in a big house with a garden.
present-perfect.subject: nosotros

present-perfect.spanish: He vivido en el centro de la ciudad desde hace años.
present-perfect.english: I've lived in the city center for years.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present.spanish: Voy al trabajo en metro todas las mañanas.
present.english: I go to work by subway every morning.
present.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Fui a París el año pasado por trabajo.
preterite.english: I went to Paris last year for work.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Irás a la entrevista de trabajo mañana.
future.english: You (informal) will go to the job interview tomorrow.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Iré a estudiar a Alemania el próximo año.
future.english: I will go to study in Germany next year.
future.subject: yo

present-progressive.spanish: Estás yendo a la escuela en bicicleta.
present-progressive.english: You (informal) are going to school by bicycle.
present-progressive.subject: tú

present-progressive.spanish: Estás yendo al gimnasio después del trabajo.
present-progressive.english: You are going to the gym after work.
present-progressive.subject: vos

going-to.spanish: Voy a ir al trabajo en metro todas las mañanas.
going-to.english: I'm going to go to work by subway every morning.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Vas a ir al gimnasio después del trabajo.
going-to.english: You're going to go to the gym after work.
going-to.subject: vos

going-to.spanish: Voy a ir al supermercado.
going-to.english: I'm going to go to the supermarket.
going-to.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: He ido al trabajo en metro todas las mañanas.
present-perfect.english: I have gone to work by subway every morning.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Has ido al gimnasio después del trabajo.
present-perfect.english: You have gone to the gym after work.
present-perfect.subject: vos

present.spanish: En la mañana la temperatura puede llegar a los cero grados centígrados.
present.english: In the morning the temperature can reach zero degrees Celsius.

present.spanish: Puedes venir a casa cuando quieras.
present.english: You can come home whenever you want.
present.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Pudimos comprar la casa de nuestros sueños.
preterite.english: We were able to buy our dream house.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Pude terminar el informe antes de la fecha límite.
preterite.english: I was able to finish the report before the deadline.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Podrás estudiar en la escuela que elijas.
future.english: You (informal) will be able to study at the school you (informal) choose.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Podrá trabajar desde casa tres días a la semana.
future.english: He will be able to work from home three days a week.
future.subject: él

present-progressive._comment: PODER is a modal verb that does not have natural present-progressive forms. 'Estar pudiendo' is grammatically possible but extremely unnatural in Spanish. Modal verbs express states of ability/possibility rather than ongoing actions. For learning purposes, this section is intentionally left empty.

going-to.spanish: Vas a poder venir a casa cuando quieras.
going-to.english: You're going to be able come home whenever you want.
going-to.subject: vos

going-to.spanish: Vamos a poder terminar el trabajo antes del viernes.
going-to.english: We're going to be able finish the work before Friday.
going-to.subject: nosotros

going-to.spanish: Voy a poder ayudarte.
going-to.english: I'm going to be able to help you.
going-to.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Puedes venir a casa cuando quieras.
present-perfect.english: You can come home whenever you want.
present-perfect.subject: vos

quality.fix_issue: English meaning incorrect + Spanish doesn't fit perfect tense

present-perfect.spanish: Hemos podido terminar el trabajo antes del viernes.
present-perfect.english: We have been able to finish the work before Friday.
present-perfect.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Quieres comprar una casa en las afueras.
present.english: You want to buy a house in the suburbs.
present.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Quisieron comprar la casa pero el precio era muy alto.
preterite.english: They wanted to buy the house but the price was too high.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Quise llamarte pero se me olvidó.
preterite.english: I wanted to call you but I forgot.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Querrás cambiar de trabajo después de graduarte.
future.english: You (informal) will want to change jobs after you (informal) graduate.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Querrás volver a tu país después de tanto tiempo.
future.english: You will want to return to your country after so long.
future.subject: vos

going-to.spanish: Va a querer estudiar español en la escuela.
going-to.english: He is going to want to study Spanish at school.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Va a querer estudiar español en la escuela.
going-to.english: She is going to want to study Spanish at school.
going-to.subject: ella

present-perfect.spanish: Ha querido estudiar español en la escuela.
present-perfect.english: He has wanted to study Spanish at school.
present-perfect.subject: él

present-perfect.spanish: Ha querido estudiar español en la escuela.
present-perfect.english: She has wanted to study Spanish at school.
present-perfect.subject: ella

present.spanish: Tiene tres hijos pequeños en casa.
present.english: He has three small children at home.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Tuviste suerte de encontrar trabajo tan rápido.
preterite.english: You were lucky to find work so quickly.
preterite.subject: vos

future.spanish: Tendré más tiempo libre el próximo mes.
future.english: I will have more free time next month.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Tendrá una entrevista de trabajo mañana.
future.english: He will have a job interview tomorrow.
future.subject: él

present-progressive.spanish: Está tomando pizza napolitana para el almuerzo.
present-progressive.english: He is having Neapolitan pizza for lunch.
present-progressive.subject: él

present-progressive.english: She is having a baby soon.
present-progressive.subject: ella

quality.fix_issue: Translation wrong; 'is having' not used for children

going-to.spanish: Va a tener tres hijos pequeños en casa.
going-to.english: He is going to have three small children at home.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Va a tener tres hijos pequeños en casa.
going-to.english: She is going to have three small children at home.
going-to.subject: ella

going-to.spanish: Vamos a tener una reunión importante.
going-to.english: We're going to have an important meeting.
going-to.subject: nosotros

present-perfect.spanish: Ha tenido tres hijos pequeños en casa.
present-perfect.english: He has had three small children at home.
present-perfect.subject: él

present-perfect.spanish: Ha tenido tres hijos pequeños en casa.
present-perfect.english: She has had three small children at home.
present-perfect.subject: ella

preterite.spanish: Fuimos compañeros de cuarto en la escuela.
preterite.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Seré doctora cuando termine la carrera.
future.english: I will be a doctor when I finish my degree.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Serás un gran artista algún día.
future.english: You (informal) will be a great artist someday.
future.subject: tú

present-progressive._comment: SER verb does not have natural present-progressive forms. 'Estar siendo' is grammatically possible but extremely unnatural in Spanish. SER expresses permanent/essential characteristics that don't work well in progressive aspect. For learning purposes, this section is intentionally left empty.

going-to.spanish: Voy a ser profesora de matemáticas en la escuela.
going-to.english: I'm going to be a mathematics professor at the school.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Va a ser médico en el hospital central.
going-to.english: He is going to be a doctor at the central hospital.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Voy a ser médico cuando sea grande.
going-to.english: I'm going to be a doctor when I grow up.
going-to.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: He sido profesora de matemáticas en la escuela.
present-perfect.english: I have been a mathematics professor at the school.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Ha sido médico en el hospital central.
present-perfect.english: He has been a doctor at the central hospital.
present-perfect.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Estuve en París durante las vacaciones.
preterite.english: I was in Paris during vacation.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Estuvimos en la playa todo el día.
preterite.english: We were at the beach all day.
preterite.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Estaré en la oficina hasta las seis.
future.english: I will be at the office until six.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Estarás mejor después del tratamiento.
future.english: You (informal) will be better after the treatment.
future.subject: tú

present-progressive._comment: ESTAR verb does not have natural present-progressive forms. 'Estar estando' is grammatically impossible (double progressive). ESTAR is typically used as an auxiliary verb for progressive constructions with other verbs, not as the main verb in progressive form. For learning purposes, this section is intentionally left empty.

going-to.spanish: Voy a estar trabajando desde casa hoy.
going-to.english: I'm going to be working from home today.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Vas a estar muy cansado después del viaje.
going-to.english: You're going to be very tired after the trip.
going-to.subject: vos

going-to.spanish: Voy a estar en casa toda la tarde.
going-to.english: I'm going to be at home all afternoon.
going-to.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: He estado trabajando desde casa hoy.
present-perfect.english: I have been working from home today.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Has estado muy cansado después del viaje.
present-perfect.english: You have been very tired after the trip.
present-perfect.subject: vos

present.spanish: En las tardes hace más calor que en las mañanas.
present.english: In the afternoons it's hotter than in the mornings.

preterite.spanish: Hiciste un gran esfuerzo para terminar a tiempo.
preterite.english: You (informal) made a great effort to finish on time.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Hizo una donación generosa a la caridad.
preterite.english: He made a generous donation to charity.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Haré mi mejor esfuerzo en el nuevo trabajo.
future.english: I will do my best in the new job.
future.subject: yo

quality.fix_issue: English translation unnatural ('do my best effort')

future.spanish: Harán un trabajo fantástico en el proyecto.
future.english: You all will do fantastic work on the project.
future.subject: vosotros

present-progressive.english: You (informal) are doing an excellent job.
present-progressive.subject: tú

present-progressive.spanish: Está haciendo la cena para toda la familia.
present-progressive.english: He is making dinner for the whole family.
present-progressive.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Vas a hacer un trabajo excelente en la oficina.
going-to.english: You (informal)'re going to do excellent work at the office.
going-to.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Va a hacer la cena para toda la familia.
going-to.english: He is going to make dinner for the whole family.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Voy a hacer café.
going-to.english: I'm going to make coffee.
going-to.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Has hecho un trabajo excelente en la oficina.
present-perfect.english: You (informal) have done excellent work at the office.
present-perfect.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: Ha hecho la cena para toda la familia.
present-perfect.english: He has made dinner for the whole family.
present-perfect.subject: él
